subject: Sales
title: Thought Leadership in Sales
description: A micro-lesson that makes Thought Leadership in Sales usable.

hook.text: A seller publishes weekly insights online. Buyers start reaching out first. The pipeline fills itself.

buildup.text: Thought leadership means sharing expertise publicly. It positions you as the go-to authority.

discovery.text: Articles, posts, and podcasts build invisible trust. Buyers choose the name they already recognize.

twist.text: It requires giving knowledge away freely. Many sellers fear this. The best ones embrace it fully.

climax.text: Share insights consistently. Over time, buyers seek you out instead of the other way around.

punchline.text: Give knowledge freely. Authority and deals follow.

quiz.question: Why should sellers share expertise for free?
options: It builds authority that attracts buyers to them
